O‘zbekiston musulmonlari idorasi bahs-munozaraga sababchi bo‘lgan toshkentlik imom ma’ruzasi yuzasidan bayonot berdi

07 Nov 2019, 22:27

O‘zbekiston musulmonlar idorasi ijtimoiy tarmoqlarda baxs-munozalarga sabab bo‘lgan Toshkentdagi “Iskandarxo‘ja” masjidi imom noibi Majidov Murodning ma’ruzasidagi Najmiddin Kubro hazratlari bilan bo‘lgan it voqeasi yuzasidan bayonot berdi.


Foto: “Daryo”

Ma’ruzada ulug‘ zotning nazari tushgan itning qabrini aylangan inson quturish kasalligidan xalos bo‘lishi to‘g‘risidagi rivoyat aytilgan.
Qayd etilishcha, O‘zbekiston musulmonlari idorasi mutaxassislari Majidov Murod bilan mazkur masala yuzasidan suhbat olib borgan. Imom-domla mutasavvif olimlar asarlarida kelgan voqealarni bayon qilish asnosida it qabrini aylanish masalasini asossiz ma’lumotlarga tayangan holda noto‘g‘ri gapni aytib yuborganini tan olgan.
“Ta’kidlash zarurki, O‘zbekiston musulmonlari idorasi imom-domlalarni doimo hujjat-dalil bilan gapirishga undaydi. Zero, dinimizni targ‘ib qilishda asossiz rivoyatlarga hojat yo‘q”, — deyiladi O‘zbekiston musulmonlari idorasi xabarida.

The Muslim Board of Uzbekistan issued a statement on the imam's speech in Tashkent, which caused controversy

07 Nov 2019, 22:27

The Muslim Board of Uzbekistan has issued a statement regarding the incident with Hazrat Najmiddin Kubro in the report of Imam Majidov Murad, the imam of the Iskandarhoja mosque in Tashkent, which has caused controversy on social media.


Photo: River

The report tells the story of a man getting rid of a rabies that has become a dog's grave.
It is noted that specialists of the Muslim Board of Uzbekistan have interviewed Majidov Murod on this issue. The imam-teacher admits that he has made the point of circulating the dog's grave in the light of what has been reported in the works of various scholars, based on unreliable information.
“It should be noted that the Muslim Board of Uzbekistan encourages imams and teachers to speak with all the evidence. There is no need for unjustified propaganda in promoting our religion, ”the Muslim Board of Uzbekistan said.
